publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2615# Cathy Peattie: International Women's Memorial Day - 28 April 2002—That the Parliament notes that 28 April 2002 is International Workers’ Memorial Day, a commemoration of those who have died or suffered accidents or ill health as a result of work, and calls for this day to be widely observed in Scotland through action to improve safety and provide a healthier working environment.
S1M-2615# International Worker's Memorial Day - 28 April 2002 (lodged on 16 January 2002) Mr Duncan McNeil*, Michael Russell*, Michael Matheson*, Trish Godman*, Margaret Jamieson*, Robin Harper*

S1M-2615# Cathy Peattie: International Worker's Memorial Day - 28 April 2002-That the Parliament notes that 28 April 2002 is International Workers' Memorial Day, a commemoration of those who have died or suffered accidents or ill health as a result of work, and calls for this day to be widely observed in Scotland through action to improve safety and provide a healthier working environment. Supported by: Mr Duncan McNeil, Michael Russell, Michael Matheson, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Robin Harper
S1M-2615# International Worker's Memorial Day - 28 April 2002 (lodged on 16 January 2002) Fiona Hyslop*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bristow Muldoon*

S1M-2615# Cathy Peattie: International Workers' Memorial Day - 28 April 2002-That the Parliament notes that 28 April 2002 is International Workers' Memorial Day, a commemoration of those who have died or suffered accidents or ill health as a result of work, and calls for this day to be widely observed in Scotland through action to improve safety and provide a healthier working environment. Supported by: Mr Duncan McNeil, Michael Russell, Michael Matheson, Trish Godman, Margaret Jamieson, Robin Harper, Fiona Hyslop, Tommy Sheridan, Bristow Muldoon, Marilyn Livingstone, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mr Michael McMahon, Nora Radcliffe, Johann Lamont, Cathie Craigie, Mr John McAllion, Scott Barrie, Fiona McLeod, Irene Oldfather, Maureen Macmillan, Des McNulty, Mr Jamie Stone, Pauline McNeill, Elaine Smith, Susan Deacon, Donald Gorrie, Bill Butler, Jackie Baillie, Ms Margo MacDonald, Linda Fabiani*
